segment.source: ACT Database Migration (Windows 10)
segment.target: ACT Database Migration (Windows 10)

segment.source: The schema for an ACT database can change when ACT is updated or when a new version of ACT is released.
segment.target: The schema for an ACT database can change when ACT is updated or when a new version of ACT is released.

segment.source: ACT Database Migration
segment.target: ACT Database Migration

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.source: Windows 8
segment.target: Windows 8

segment.source: Windows 7
segment.target: Windows 7

segment.source: Windows Server 2012
segment.target: Windows Server 2012

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2

segment.source: The schema for an ACT database can change when ACT is updated or when a new version of ACT is released.
segment.target: The schema for an ACT database can change when ACT is updated or when a new version of ACT is released.

segment.source: If the schema for an ACT database does not match the current schema, you can migrate the compatibility data to a new database.
segment.target: If the schema for an ACT database does not match the current schema, you can migrate the compatibility data to a new database.

segment.source: You can then use the current version of ACT to open the new database.
segment.target: You can then use the current version of ACT to open the new database.

segment.source: To create the new database, you must have database-creation permissions on the instance of SQL Server.
segment.target: To create the new database, you must have database-creation permissions on the instance of SQL Server.

segment.source: Migrating Compatibility Data from an ACT Database
segment.target: Migrating Compatibility Data from an ACT Database

segment.source: You can migrate compatibility data from an ACT database to a new database by using one of the following methods:
segment.target: You can migrate compatibility data from an ACT database to a new database by using one of the following methods:

segment.source: Run Application Compatibility Manager (ACM), and then use the ACT Configuration Wizard to open the database.
segment.target: Run Application Compatibility Manager (ACM), and then use the ACT Configuration Wizard to open the database.

segment.source: The wizard guides you through migrating the compatibility data to a new database.
segment.target: The wizard guides you through migrating the compatibility data to a new database.

segment.source: Run the MigrateDB.sql file, located at %SYSTEMDRIVE%ProgramDataMicrosoftApplication Compatibility ToolkitMigrateDB.sql..
segment.target: Run the MigrateDB.sql file, located at %SYSTEMDRIVE%ProgramDataMicrosoftApplication Compatibility ToolkitMigrateDB.sql..

segment.source: The following table shows the location of the MigrateDB.sql file.
segment.target: The following table shows the location of the MigrateDB.sql file.

segment.source: Database Migration from ACT 5.6
segment.target: Database Migration from ACT 5.6

segment.source: When you migrate compatibility data from an ACT 5.6 database to a new database, the following information is excluded from the migration:
segment.target: When you migrate compatibility data from an ACT 5.6 database to a new database, the following information is excluded from the migration:

segment.source: Issues that were reported by ACT 5.6 data-collection packages (DCPs).
segment.target: Issues that were reported by ACT 5.6 data-collection packages (DCPs).

segment.source: Solutions that correspond to issues reported by ACT 5.6 DCPs.
segment.target: Solutions that correspond to issues reported by ACT 5.6 DCPs.

segment.source: Lists of file names that ACT 5.6 associated with each application.
segment.target: Lists of file names that ACT 5.6 associated with each application.

segment.source: You cannot migrate any compatibility data from ACT databases that were created on a version of ACT before ACT 5.6.
segment.target: You cannot migrate any compatibility data from ACT databases that were created on a version of ACT before ACT 5.6.
